info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 10:51AM EDT until July 20 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Menifee. In southeast Kentucky, Morgan.
* WHEN...Until 1215 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall from earlier thunderstorms. Minor flooding and quick runoff are likely ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - No additional rainfall is imminent, but additional rainfall is likely later today and tonight. A Flood Watch goes into effect at 1 PM EDT this afternoon and remains in effect through 8 PM EDT Monday Evening. Please refer to that bulletin for more information. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wellington, Artville, Korea, Ezel, Omer and Denniston.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
